intro: Microtropis basilanensis, commonly known as the Basilan mountain vine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and woody stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland to montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
